thread.title: Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT
thread.title_full: Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT

title: Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT Robert Alford returned an interception 59 yards for a touchdown, lifting the undefeated Atlanta Falcons to a 25-19 win over the Washington Redskins in overtime Sunday. Post to Facebook Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT Robert Alford returned an interception 59 yards for a touchdown, lifting the undefeated Atlanta Falcons to a 25-19 win over the Washington Redskins in overtime Sunday.  //on.11alive.com/1RBPEQp   Join the Conversation To   Alford's INT return lifts Falcons past Redskins 25-19 in OT Charles Odum, Associated Press 1:25 a.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Robert Alford #23 of the Atlanta Falcons stiff arms Chris Thompson #25 of the Washington Redskins as he returns an interception at Georgia Dome on October 11, 2015 in Atlanta, Georgia. (Photo: Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ATLANTA (AP) - Robert Alford returned an interception 59 yards for a touchdown, lifting the undefeated Atlanta Falcons to a 25-19 win over the Washington Redskins in overtime Sunday. 
The Redskins had the first possession of OT, and Kirk Cousins moved the team to midfield. When wide receiver Ryan Grant slipped on a pass route, Alford caught Cousins' pass and was left with open field down the Falcons' sideline for the touchdown. 
Devonta Freeman's apparent 13-yard TD catch in the final minute of regulation was ruled incomplete on a review. Freeman scored on 6-yard run two plays later to give Atlanta a 19-16 lead. Dustin Hopkins' 52-yard field goal on the final play of regulation forced overtime. 
The Falcons (5-0) overcame two interceptions and a lost fumble by Matt Ryan. Freeman had 27 carries for 153 yards and the touchdown. 
The Redskins (2-3) were denied their attempt for their first back-to-back wins in almost a year - since Weeks 7 and 8 in 2014. (Copyright 2015 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.) Read or Share this story: http://on.11alive.com/1RBPEQp TOP VIDEOS
